result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action on all counts.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 years upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul M Moore in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Defendant Paul M Moore in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 3, 5 & 6.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 3, 5 & 6. Court dismisses Cts. 2 & 4 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 4/07/16)
No contact direct or indirect with Bay Point Inn and M.D.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Paul M Moore appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers who appears in person.  Defendant Paul M Moore in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gerbers will be representing defendant. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State requests cash bond with conditions. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 11:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Paul M Moore
Current: 139 N. 4th Ave., Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235   (Effective: 02-29-2016)
Prior: 324 Quincy St, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Paul M Moore appears by video conference along with attorney Brett E Reetz who appears by phone.  Defendant Paul M Moore in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Reetz makes oral motion to withdraw from the case. Defendant has no objection. Court grants request. Court reviews events in file. Defendant requests time to talk to PD to get counsel appointed. Atty Gerbers also present in court, indicates he has to go down to the jail later today, will talk to defendant. Court will recall case later this afternoon.

Attorney Brett E Reetz in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Reetz indicates his office advised defendant of todays hearing. Defendant indicated to Atty Reetz that he had to work. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant. Atty Reetz anticipates filling a motion to withdraw in both cases.
Email from DA's office indicating Atty Reetz will accept service on the new case.
